page.title: 20YOXALL_HISTORY & BUILDINGS
page.content: Longcoft Hall,demolished c1950 was once the home of the brother of Mary Arden,mother of William Shakespeare. The Grange,Main St.with 17th C Dutch gables was originally the Rectory and has a tiny room thought to be a priest's hole. The tithe barn was converted to a National girls' school in 1817.The Old Hall on Main St. demolished in 1960 once belonged to Zachariah Lightwood,ironmonger,who issued his own tokens known as "Yoxall Pennies".The family were village apothecaries until 1804.The site is now part of a modern estate.The Hollies at Bond End,a 3 storey Georgian house was once a tape mill. The Rookery next door was once the manager's house.Reeve End Cottage is the only known aisled hall remaining in Staffs.dated pre 1350 probably a Needwood Forest manager's house.
